data.title: Crow Holdings
data.meta_description: Over the past 75 years, the Crow Holdings team has attracted some of the most talented professionals in real estate investment and development.
data.text:
Mike Lafitte

Advisory Board

Crow Holdings Development

Mike Lafitte joined Trammell Crow Company in 1997 and after CBRE acquired TCC in 2006, Mr. Lafitte continued to serve for a combined 26 years in numerous executive leadership roles. Mr. Lafitte’s roles included serving as Chief Executive Officer of Trammell Crow Company (wholly owned subsidiary of CBRE), CEO of CBRE’s Real Estate Investment Segment, CEO of CBRE’s Advisory Services Segment, Global Group President, Global Chief Operating Officer, and President of CBRE Americas. Mr. Lafitte served on CBRE’s Executive Committee for over 15 years and was the Executive Sponsor of Black Excellence, a CBRE employee resource group. During the TCC years, Mr. Lafitte held various roles including President of Global Services, Chief Operating Officer of Global Services, Regional Director of the Central region of the U.S. and Dallas Market Leader.

Mr. Lafitte retired from CBRE/TCC in 2023 and currently serves as Managing Partner of Maplewood Ventures LLC, an investment partnership. Mr. Lafitte serves on the board of Ball Ventures (private family office in Idaho), SMU Cox School of Business, Baylor Healthcare Foundation, East-West Ministries, and W.A. Criswell Foundation, and he was previously a member of the Real Estate Roundtable, Dallas Citizens Council, and UT Austin Real Estate Finance and Investment Center along with other non-profit organizations.

Prior to CBRE/TCC, Mr. Lafitte held various development, production, and leadership roles starting with Lincoln Property Company followed by Bear Stearns Real Estate Group and Premisys Real Estate Services (wholly owned operating company of Prudential Life Insurance Company).

Mr. Lafitte is a native of Dallas and is a graduate of the University of Texas at Austin (BBA) and Southern Methodist University (MBA). Mr. Lafitte is a member of the Salesmanship Club of Dallas and is a licensed Real Estate Broker in the State of Texas. Mr. Lafitte and his wife have a growing family with two daughters, one son and two grandchildren.

Randy Pace

Advisory Board

Crow Holdings Development

Randy J. Pace, CPA, served as the Chief Financial Officer and a national partner at Trammell Crow Residential, beginning in 1987 and until his retirement from full-time employment in 1998. In those positions, he served an integral role in strategic planning for TCR, which led to two initial public offerings in 1993-1994 and multiple mergers with existing public Real Estate Investment Trusts in 1997-1998. He began his tenure at the company as the CFO for TCR’s East region. Prior to his service at TCR, Mr. Pace was employed as a tax specialist in the Atlanta office of Grant Thornton and as Assistant Treasurer – Corporate Acquisitions for Cronus Industries in Dallas. Mr. Pace began his career as a tax manager specializing in real estate for Arthur Anderson & Co.

In addition to serving on Crow Holdings Development’s Advisory Board, Mr. Pace sits on TCR’s Advisory and Investment Committees. He served on the Interfaith Housing Coalition from 1998 to 2001, as a commissioner of the Dallas Housing Authority 2002-2004, and on the board of the Cole Corporate Income Trust public REIT from 2011 to 2015, which merged with Select Income REIT.

Mr. Pace graduated magna cum laude from the University of Georgia with a Bachelor of Business Administration degree in 1973. An avid golfer, in 2006, Mr. Pace played all of Golf magazine’s 2005 Top 100 golf courses in the world. He and his wife Amy live on St. Simons Island in Georgia.

Leonard Wood Sr.

Advisory Board

Crow Holdings Development

Leonard W. Wood and his son Kevin Wood founded Woodlands Apartment Communities in 2021. The company is focusing on developing attainable multifamily projects in the greater Atlanta area. In 2013 he merged GLJ Partners, a southern California apartment development company founded by Mr. Wood in 2008, into Trammell Crow Residential. Starting in November 2013, Mr. Wood joined the Advisory Board of Trammell Crow Residential where he continues to serve.

Mr. Wood retired as CEO of Wood Partners, LLC in November 2007. Mr. Wood founded the company in April 1998, and its primary focus continues to be the development of apartment and condominium homes in the Baltimore/Washington D.C. area, Boston, New York, the Southeast, Florida, Texas, Colorado, Nevada, Arizona, Seattle, and California. At the time of Mr. Wood’s retirement, Wood Partners had started, since inception, over 41,000 multifamily units representing an investment of more than $5.6 billion. Wood Partners was the largest multi-family builder in the U.S. in 2004, the 3rd largest in 2005, and the 6th largest in 2006 according to Builder Magazine. Wood Partners also received the 2006 Fastest Growing Private Builder award from Builder Magazine. Mr. Wood continued to serve on the Board of Directors through the end of 2013. Wood Partners celebrates its 25th anniversary in 2023, and it remains a highly regarded and successful national multifamily firm.

Prior to founding Wood Partners, Mr. Wood joined Trammell Crow Residential (“TCR”) as Partner in charge of North Florida in 1982. In 1985, he moved to Atlanta to assume responsibility for the Southeast Region. Over time, Mr. Wood also accepted responsibility for the Texas, Midwest, and Southwest Regions. The primary focus of Trammell Crow Residential is apartment acquisition, development, and management. In January of 1994, five operating companies that worked with Mr. Wood in Texas, Georgia, and Tennessee combined and had an initial public offering as Gables Residential Trust, a New York Stock Exchange REIT. In November of 1997, TCR sold its Southwestern assets and operations to BRE Properties, Inc. (NYSE). In December of 1997, TCR sold its Midwestern assets and operations to Avalon Properties, Inc. (NYSE) and AMLI Residential Properties Trust (NYSE). In March of 1998, TCR sold its North Florida assets to Merry Land & Investment Co., Inc. (NYSE), who subsequently merged with Equity Residential (NYSE). During Mr. Wood’s tenure at TCR, he started over 54,000 multi-family units representing an investment of more than $2.5 billion.

In October of 1996, Homegate Hospitality, Inc. (“Homegate”) had its Initial Public Offering. Homegate combined TCR’s development capabilities with Wyndham Hotel Company’s management expertise to create an extended-stay hotel chain. Mr. Wood was on the Board of Directors of Homegate. In December of 1997, Homegate merged with Prime Hospitality, a New York Stock Exchange lodging company. Subsequently, Prime sold to Marriott.

Mr. Wood is a 1972 University of North Carolina M.B.A. graduate, with an undergraduate degree from N.C. State University in 1968. As an Audit Manager with Arthur Andersen & Co., Mr. Wood had an extensive real estate clientele. In 1977, Mr. Wood became the Controller for Brandermill, “the best planned community in America.” In 1979, Mr. Wood became General Manager of Fripp Island, a large-scale planned unit development including both real estate development and sales, as well as resort operations.

Mr. Wood is a former Chairman and served on the Board of the Multifamily Leadership Board of the National Association of Home Builders. He also is a former Chairman and served on the Board of Directors of the National Multifamily Housing Council. Mr. Wood is a past Governor, Trustee, and Chairman of the Multifamily Council of the Urban Land Institute. He is active in numerous charities with a particular focus on education. Mr. Wood has also been active with various wounded warrior programs. His youngest son, Kevin, served two tours in Iraq. He has also served on the Board of Visitors of the University of North Carolina’s Kenan-Flagler Business School. In 2001, Mr. Wood received the MBA Alumni Merit Award from the University of North Carolina. In 2007, Mr. Wood founded the Wood Center for Real Estate Studies as a part of the Kenan-Flagler Business School and is the Chairman Emeritus of its Advisory Board. In 2018, Mr. Wood was awarded the Davie Award, the highest award a UNC alumni can receive. He formerly served on the Board of the Darlington School. He was formerly a Board member of Cole Credit Property Trust III, Inc. and Cole Corporate Income Trust, Inc. Mr. Wood served on the Board of the Ocean Reef Club, the largest private club in the world. He is a Past President of Card Sound Golf Club in Key Largo, Florida.

Garth Erdossy

Senior Managing Director

Multifamily

Trammell Crow Residential

Garth Erdossy is a Senior Managing Director for the California Division of Trammell Crow Residential, the multifamily development company of Crow Holdings. Based in Carlsbad, he is responsible for managing all aspects of the business within the region including site selection and acquisition, team building, securing project entitlements, project design, construction oversight, management of all development related activities, and project capitalization.

Garth was President and Managing Partner for GLJ Partners, a Southern California-based multifamily development and construction company, which he co-founded in 2007 with Leonard Wood. Garth and his partners at GLJ merged the company with TCR in July 2012.

Prior to forming GLJ Partners, he partnered with Curt Olson to form Nexus Residential Communities Inc., which developed and constructed attached for-sale and for-rent product. As President and CEO, he oversaw all acquisition, development and construction of projects in Southern California.

Over his career, Garth has capitalized and developed over 13,000 multifamily units worth well over $4.5 billion. Garth developed over 1,000 hotel rooms with Homegate Hospitality and was responsible for the acquisition and rehabilitation of over 1,300 multifamily units in the western United States. He started and ran two of Trammell Crow Residential’s development and construction divisions in the Rocky Mountains and Southern California, which were later sold to BRE, a San-Francisco-based REIT, for approximately $600 million in November 1997.

Garth received a Bachelor of Arts in International Relations from the University of Virginia and a master’s degree in Finance and Real Estate from the Kenan-Flagler Business School at the University of North Carolina. He is Chairman of the Transit Oriented Development Council at the Urban Land Institute and is an active member of the National Multi-Housing Housing Council.

Elie Finegold

Managing Director

Venture & Technology

Crow Holdings

Elie Finegold is a Managing Director at Crow Holdings, where he leads the firm’s new venture and technology investment practice. He has been an entrepreneur and leader at the intersection of real estate and technology for nearly 20 years, and currently also serves as a Venture Advisor at MetaProp, the leading, early-stage PropTech VC fund, and as an advisor to numerous early and growth stage companies.

Prior to joining Crow Holdings, he led Global Innovation at CBRE, establishing the function during the formative years of the current wave of real estate technology. He was a founding member of real estate merchant banking firm Island Capital Group and was the President and co-founder of IGY Marinas, which, under his leadership, grew into a $1.5 billion AUM vertically integrated global real estate business that is the world’s largest owner, operator, and developer of mega-yacht marinas and waterfront mixed-use projects. Elie was also the Chief Innovation Officer of the former Insignia Financial Group and founded several startups in both the real estate and technology sectors. He continues to be a leader in the evolution of the PropTech industry, serving on numerous industry leadership boards and writing and speaking around the world on the subject.

Elie graduated magna cum laude from Harvard University with a Special Concentration in Music and Culture, with his academic works published by Harvard Library Press.

Donna Kruger

Chief Financial Officer

Finance

Trammell Crow Residential

Donna Kruger is a Chief Financial Officer of Trammell Crow Residential, the multifamily development company of Crow Holdings. Donna brings over 25 years of experience in the analysis and management of real estate assets. More than 20 years have been focused on asset management and finance related to the development, construction, and management of Class A multifamily residential property.

Donna’s tenure with TCR began in 2003 when she became Chief Financial Officer for the Southeast division. During this time, she was responsible for all financing, asset management, acquisition and disposition activities in the Southeast region, including the Southeast, Carolinas, and North Florida divisions. In 2010 her territory expanded to include the entire east coast, as well as Houston, and her focus shifted to financing, refinancing, and disposition. Since joining TCR, Donna has been involved in financing over 100 multifamily projects (both rental and for-sale condominiums) with a total capitalization of over $5.5 billion; she has also been responsible for the disposition of 58 apartment properties with an aggregate value of approximately $3 billion.

Prior to joining TCR, Donna was an asset manager with JPI from 1996 to 2003, and was responsible for all JPI assets located in the southeast – including the lease-up and stabilization of 19 newly developed Class A multifamily rental properties and the disposition of 14 multi-family assets with an aggregate value of $500,000,000.

Mark G. Roberts

Managing Director

Research

Crow Holdings

Mark G. Roberts is Managing Director of Research at Crow Holdings, where his primary responsibilities include the development of insights, market research, and commentary on real estate topics of interest to investors, developers, operators, and other industry participants. Mark’s position is shared with the Robert and Margaret Folsom Institute for Real Estate at SMU Cox School of Business, where he extends his expertise into the classroom, teaching market analysis and strategy to undergraduate and graduate students.

Mark, a fellow at the Real Estate Research Institute, a regular contributor to the National Council of Real Estate Investment Fiduciaries, and a registered architect, has over 30 years of real estate experience. He recently served as Executive Director of the Real Estate Center at the UT Austin’s McCombs School of Business, and he previously served as a Managing Director at DWS Real Estate, where he held several senior leadership positions including Head of Research & Strategy, Alternatives and Real Assets, Head of U.S. Multi-asset & Solutions, and Co-Head of Research.

Prior to joining DWS’s Real Estate in 2011, he served as Global Head of Research at Invesco Real Estate, a division of Invesco Asset Management Limited. Mark was the Chairman of the Board of NCREIF, President of RERI, Chairman of the NCREIF Research Committee, and a member of the NCREIF Fund-Index Subcom­mittee, which developed the NFI-ODCE Index. He initiated and served on the Leadership Committee of the Global Real Estate Fund Index, which is a joint effort of NCREIF (US), INREV (Europe), and ANREV (Asia-Pacific).

Mark holds a Master of Science in Real Estate from the Massachusetts Insti­tute of Technology and a Bachelor of Arts in Architecture from the University of Illinois at Urbana.

Shawnee Tharp

Vice President

Multifamily

Trammell Crow Residential

Shawnee Tharp is a Vice President in the Asset Management group at Trammell Crow Residential, the multifamily development company of Crow Holdings. Her responsibilities include deployment of the investment strategies for the full business cycle of multifamily investments including acquisitions, ongoing asset management, and disposition. This includes providing underwriting support, market evaluation, customer research, and community set up for new assets. She is responsible for the financial and operational performance of her portfolio. She develops the strategic business plan for each asset and oversees the property management teams that implement them. She works closely with partners to implement tactics that will maximize proceeds at disposition.

Shawnee started her career at TCR in 2019. She has been in Real Estate since 1993 and has held positions including Vice President of Operations for Centerspace, Vice President of Asset Management for Lifestyle Communities, and Group Vice President of Operations for Essex Property Trust. In addition to her most recent roles, she has held various titles including Community Manager, Regional Manager, Division Manager, and the Director of Due Diligence.

Shawnee grew up in the industry, beginning her career as a bookkeeper on site when she was 19. She served on the Board of Advisors for the Tri-County California Apartment Association as well as the Housing Industry Foundation.

Ken Valach

Chief Executive Officer

Leadership

Crow Holdings Development

Ken Valach is the Chief Executive Officer of Crow Holdings Development, a leading real estate development company specializing in multifamily, industrial, and office projects across high-opportunity markets in the United States. CHD is a subsidiary of Crow Holdings, a privately owned real estate investment and development firm with 75 years of history and $30 billion in assets under management.

Ken has been with Crow Holdings-affiliated companies since 1989, when he joined Trammell Crow Residential, the multifamily development platform of CHD and served a variety of positions with TCR before assuming the role of CEO in 2009. In 2015, Ken was also named as leader of the industrial development team to help build a national platform for development of speculative and build-to-suit industrial projects. CHD launched an office platform in 2020, which Ken also oversees.

Previously, Ken served as Chief Financial Officer of a private company in Southern California and as a management consultant with Price Waterhouse. He received a Bachelor of Arts in Economics and Math, cum laude, from Claremont McKenna College, where he has served as a member of the Board of Trustees since 2009 and was appointed Board Chair in July 2024. He received a Master of Business Administration from Stanford Graduate School of Business.

In addition to his role and responsibilities with CHD, Ken is the Chair of the National Multifamily Housing Council, a Director of Kimble Senior Housing, and Chairman of New Hope Housing, which serves extremely low-income individuals and families. He serves on the board of Coalition for the Homeless and is also a member of the Urban Land Institute, the Harvard Joint Center for Housing Studies Advisory Board, and the Real Estate Roundtable.
